# Introduction

Probability distributions with explicit forms of densities are core elements of statistical inference. In this post, we review Angular Central Gaussian (ACG) distribution on a unit hypersphere $\mathbb{S}^{p-1} \subset \mathbb{R}^p$ and its extension - Matrix Angular Central Gaussian (MACG) distribution - defined on Stiefel $St(p,r)$ and Grassmann $Gr(p,r)$ manifolds.

# Angular Central Gaussian Distribution

We first review the ACG distribution on $\mathbb{S}^{p-1}$, which has a density $$
f_{ACG} (x|A) = |A|^{-1/2} (x^\top A x)^{-p/2}\,\, \text{for}~x\in\mathbb{S}^{p-1},

$$ where $A$ is a symmetric positive-definite matrix and $\vert \cdot \vert$ denotes a matrix determinant. Let's recap some properties of ACG distribution.
